description:
In the year 2075, mankind has reached a point where journeying between Earth, the moon and the space stations is part of daily life. However, the progression of technology in space has also resulted in the problem of the space debris, which can cause excessive and even catastrophic damage to spacecrafts and equipment. This is the story of Technora's Debris Collecting section, its EVA worker, Hachirota "Hachimaki" Hoshino, and the newcomer to the group, Ai Tanabe.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Space
tags.description: Partly or completely set in outer space.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Terrorism
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a terrorist or terrorist organization.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Tanned Skin
tags.description: Prominently features characters with tanned skin.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Unrequited Love
tags.description: One or more characters are experiencing an unrequited love that may or may not be reciprocated.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

node.description: Rafael Antonio "Tony" Olivier is a Puerto Rican-born American voice actor best known for voicing Rick Hunter from Robotech, Lancer from Fate/stay night, and Arsène Lupin III from Lupin the Third. He helped produce the live action shows Mighty Morphin Power Rangers and VR Troopers.

[Official Website ](http://kuroishihitomi.com/) | [Twitter ](https://twitter.com/kuroishihitomi) | [Spotify ](https://open.spotify.com/artist/1FXpihPpl4BxBlfGk3jfjx?autoplay=true)

Hitomi Kuroishi is a Japanese female singer-songwriter and composer, born in Kanazawa, Ishikawa Prefecture. She is credited simply as "Hitomi" for her vocals, not to be confused with J-pop singer "hitomi". Under Kim Studio (ケイ・アイ・エム; K, I, M). Used to be in 3-person unit Dolce Triade.

[Official Website ](http://kuroishihitomi.com/) | [Twitter ](https://twitter.com/kuroishihitomi) | [Spotify ](https://open.spotify.com/artist/1FXpihPpl4BxBlfGk3jfjx?autoplay=true)

Hitomi Kuroishi is a Japanese female singer-songwriter and composer, born in Kanazawa, Ishikawa Prefecture. She is credited simply as "Hitomi" for her vocals, not to be confused with J-pop singer "hitomi". Under Kim Studio (ケイ・アイ・エム; K, I, M). Used to be in 3-person unit Dolce Triade.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/raintreemikio) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/酒井ミキオ) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mikio_Sakai)

Affiliated with Solid Force.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/128469808)

Handles design research. Animates and designs stuff on occasion.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/quarter_law) | [Profile](http://www.undecided.co.jp/profile.html) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E4%B8%AD%E5%B7%9D%E5%B9%B8%E5%A4%AA%E9%83%8E)

Japanese composer and arranger. He graduated from Tokyo University of the Arts' school of music. He is the son of musician and trumpet player Yoshihiro Nakagawa and older brother of the trombonist [Eijirou Nakagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/271401/Eijirou-Nakagawa). He has done music for various anime, dramas, films, and tokusatsu shows.

Nakagawa is known for collaborating with director [Gorou Taniguchi](https://anilist.co/staff/98066/Gorou-Taniguchi), and has written and composed the scores for many of his projects since [s-CRY-ed](https://anilist.co/anime/168/sCRYed/) in 2001. Including the acclaimed [Code Geass](https://anilist.co/anime/1575/Code-Geass-Lelouch-of-the-Rebellion/) series. Outside anime, he is also noted for his work on many Super Sentai and Kamen Rider series.

**Notable works outside anime as composer:**
~!- Hyakujuu Sentai Gaoranger (tokusatsu, TV series, 2001)
- GoGo Sentai Boukenger (tokusatsu, TV series, 2006)
- Kamen Rider Decade (tokusatsu, TV series, 2009) (with Shuuhei Naruse)
- Kamen Rider W (tokusatsu, TV series, 2009-10) (with Shuuhei Naruse)
- Kamen Rider OOO (tokusatsu, TV series, 2010) 
- Kamen Rider Wizard (tokusatsu, TV series, 2012-13)
- Kamen Rider Drive (tokusatsu, TV series, 2014) (with Shuuhei Naruse)
- Kamen Rider Revice (tokusatsu, TV series, 2021)!~

[Official Website ](http://kuroishihitomi.com/) | [Twitter ](https://twitter.com/kuroishihitomi) | [Spotify ](https://open.spotify.com/artist/1FXpihPpl4BxBlfGk3jfjx?autoplay=true)

Hitomi Kuroishi is a Japanese female singer-songwriter and composer, born in Kanazawa, Ishikawa Prefecture. She is credited simply as "Hitomi" for her vocals, not to be confused with J-pop singer "hitomi". Under Kim Studio (ケイ・アイ・エム; K, I, M). Used to be in 3-person unit Dolce Triade.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/浦上靖夫)

Founder of [Audio Planning U](https://anilist.co/studio/6561/), and the father of [Keiko](https://anilist.co/staff/162367/) and [Yasuyuki Urakami](https://anilist.co/staff/144509/).

In 2016, he received an Honorary Achievement Award for his role as a sound director in [Detective Conan](https://anilist.co/anime/235/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ichirou_o)

Waseda University graduate. Best known as the co-creator of [Code Geass](https://anilist.co/anime/1575/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/raintreemikio) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/酒井ミキオ) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mikio_Sakai)

Affiliated with Solid Force.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Kudo_M_) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kudo_m_/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCVcxdd04vCuhr-1t7mDh3gg)

Originating from [Artland](https://anilist.co/studio/8/). Most known for his work on the [Bleach](https://anilist.co/anime/269/) franchise.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/raintreemikio) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/酒井ミキオ) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mikio_Sakai)

Affiliated with Solid Force.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/makotoyukimura)

Before writing his own manga he started out as an assistant to Shin Morimura. He debuted in 2000 with Planetes, which was adapted to a 26-episode anime. He is currently working on Vinland Saga which began serialization in Weekly Shounen Magazine, and later on continued serialization in Afternoon.

He has won the 2009 Japan Media Arts Festival Grand Prize for Vinland Saga.
